intro: Ifloga aristulata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Ifloga aristulata thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
